summary: Feature request to return workflow status as a human-readable string instead of a gRPC enum number in WorkflowExecutionDescription. Currently users must build wrappers to translate numeric status codes to meaningful strings.
userImpact: Users currently need to write wrapper code to convert numeric workflow status codes to human-readable strings when calling handle.describe().
proposedFix: Change WorkflowExecutionDescription.status from a numeric enum to a string union type like 'Canceled' | 'Completed' | 'Continued_As_New' | 'Failed' | etc.
workaround: Build a wrapper around handle.describe() response to manually translate gRPC codes to meaningful status strings.
resolutionDetails: Feature was accepted and implemented to return workflow status as a string type instead of numeric gRPC enum.
keyQuote: Return a string type to represent status in the WorkflowExecutionDescription.
